io.rivers

Class Lexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.rivers.LexerDemo

  • public class Lexer
extends java.lang.Object
    A class used to do lexing for arithmetic expressions with +, -, *, /. It takes input from a String, either with method lex() or with its String-parameter constructor. There can be multiple lines in one input. It can be used to lex multiple input. Once a new input String is provided, the information about the former String is lost. After calling method output(), it will output the result with each line being
    <line-number> <token-type> <text-content>
    For example, when you execute 
    Lexer lexer = new Lexer(); lexer.lex("1+2"); lexer.output();
    The output will be 
     line 1 token: NUM_OR_ID text: 1
 line 1 token: PLUS text: +
 line 1 token: NUM_OR_ID text: 2
